alert.note: Alert for Mower (Minnesota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS LaCrosse (Southwestern Wisconsin, Southeastern Minnesota, and Northeast Iowa)
info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued July 24 at 12:09AM CDT until July 24 at 2:30AM CDT by NWS LaCrosse
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 230 AM CDT EARLY THIS MORNING FOR MOWER COUNTY... At 1209 AM CDT, gauge reports indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area. Between 4 and 7 inches of rain have fallen. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Gauges reported. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Austin, Grand Meadow, Brownsdale, Lansing, Racine, Mayville, Dexter, Mapleview, Waltham, Elkton, Sargeant, Renova, County Roads 1 And 7, Interstate 90 And County 1, County Roads 1 And 15, Brookside Campground, Highways 63 And 16 and Hamilton. FLASH FLOOD...GAUGE INDICATED
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
